    PhD, Environmental Sciences, UVA.

    Abinash Bhattachan

    MS Graduate, Indiana University

    Abi has a BSc in Watershed Science from Utah State University and MSc in Environmental Science from Indiana University. He received his PhD from the University of Virginia, working with Paolo O’Dorico. For his dissertation, he studied the effects of dune mobilization on dust emission and land degradation in Southern Kalahari.

    He is now doing a postdoc at NC State University, investigating the socio-environmental impacts of sea level rise in coastal North Carolina.

    Caylor Lab at AGU 2016 Fall Meeting

    Article accepted in PLoS One

    WAVES Lab Publications by Abinash Bhattachan

    A quantitative description of the interspecies diversity of belowground structure in savanna woody plants

    O’Donnell, F.C., Caylor, K.K., Bhattachan, A., Dintwe, K., D’Odorico, P., and Okin, G.S. (2015) A quantitative description of the interspecies diversity of belowground structure in savanna woody plants. Ecosphere 6(9):154. doi:10.1890/ ES14-00310.1

    An analysis of structure: biomass structure relationships for characteristic species of the western Kalahari, Botswana

    Meyer, T., D’Odorico, P., Okin, G.S., Shugart, H.H., Caylor, K.K., O’Donnell, F.C., Bhattachan, A., Dintwe, K. (2013) “An analysis of structure: biomass structure relationships for characteristic species of the western Kalahari, Botswana”, African Journal of Ecology, doi:10.1111/ aje.12086

    Evaluating ecohydrological theories of woody root distribution in the Kalahari

    Bhattachan A, Tatlhego M, Dintwe K, O’Donnell F, Caylor KK, et al. (2012) Evaluating Ecohydrological Theories of Woody Root Distribution in the Kalahari. PLoS ONE 7(3): e33996. doi:10.1371/ journal.pone.0033996
